ds.t: The best {arbiters} train both body and mind. Accrue as much knowledge as possible to succeed in the trials ahead.
The enemy escaped!
An enemy has arrived!
Failed to steal!
Gathered {0} {1}{color=item}{2}{color=base}!
That was the last one! Now to decipher them...
Obtained Key Item {color=item}{0}{color=base}!
Key Items can be viewed from the {hint-wm-menu} by selecting {button-menuitems}.
Found {color=item}{0}{color=base}!
Ah, {herotitle} {hero}! What can we help you with today?
In need of new recruits?
Nothing to steal!
Received {color=item}{0}{color=base}!
Stole {0}{color=item}{1}{color=base}!
Welcome to my store. Only the finest. Peruse at your leisure.
Please, have a look around, friends!
I is full of powerful equipment! Purchase, purchase!
Be pleased.
Vires in Numeris.
Hey, {human} customers! Don't see many of your kind around here. Let me know if you need anything.
Hmph. Buy something or begone.
Welcome to Murphy's! It's rough seas around these parts. You'll want to prepare accordingly.
Welcome to kind {arbiters}! Best goods here! Buy lots!
Let's get you outfitted.
Found {0} {1}{color=item}{2}{color=base}!
A new female outfit has been unlocked at the {guild}!
A new outfit has been unlocked at the {guild}!
A new male outfit has been unlocked at the {guild}!
A new headwear has been unlocked at the {guild}!
A new portrait has been unlocked at the {guild}!
This bridge is so long, I can barely make out the other end! How long do you think it took to build?
{immortal2} would probably know. It must be as ancient as he is.
It's very impressive.
What have we here? Another {marked}?
Greetings to you, fellow travelers!
No doubt on their way to the {mapname-kawacity} {temple}.
You're wasting your time. The {kawas} won't allow anyone to access the {temple}.
And they are too many to slay.
Not that it will matter to a bunch of corpses. Lay down your weapons and we'll make it quick. Relatively quick, anyway.
We have no quarrel with you. Pray that doesn't change and be on your way.
Hahaha! No. The way I figure it, since we can't enter the {temple}, we'll simply off every other {marked} as they arrive.<page>Then I will be declared the winner of this little game by default!
I don't think that's how it works...
Boss. Me former crew went after them bastards before. As ye can see, it didn't bear the expected fruits. They're brutal and merciless. Best be wary.
And this was the perfect reminder as to why {marked} have such a short lifespan.
Unless they become an {immortal}, that is.
That {marked} said the {kawas} were blocking anyone from entering the {temple}. What are we going to do?
I've had dealings with the {kawa} elders before. I know them to be reasonable.<page>They probably have a good reason for blocking access to the {temple}, and perhaps we'll be able to help.
In any event, no use worrying about it, right? We'll see what it's about once we get there.
Let's get going.
Oh, and {hunter}?
Yes, boss?
We might yet make an {arbiter} out of you, I think.
Hmph.<page>As ye say, boss.
And our challengers are left with naught but the bitter taste of defeat! And bring a bigger sword next time!
What a triumph against the odds! I am thrilled beyond words to announce our new Champions of the Tournament!<page>Our sincere congratulations to the victors. Well done!
And now a quick reminder that we'll be hosting another Tournament later this year. I hope to see the same phenomenal crowd then!
A glorious victory! Will our fearless warriors continue the fight, or retire with their winnings?
{hunter}, you disappoint me. Betraying our cause when we're so close to our objective.
After what I witnessed at the {temple}, it's not *our* cause nay more.
But I'm a reasonable lass. I know how to hold me tongue. I'll be on me way now and leave nothin' behind but fond memories.
Ah, no. You won't be going anywhere.
Trusting a bounty hunter was a mistake on my part. Your kind knows but one kind of loyalty, to coin.
Dispose of her. When you are finished, rejoin us at the {mapname-kawacity} {temple}.
Tsk. Shoulda seen that comin'.
Bah! I've already seen enough swamp to last a lifetime.
Hey, isn't that {hunter}?
It sure is. {rebel-faction} must have decided to take the {mapname-coastal01} shortcut too.
Although it looks as though {hunter} has fallen out of grace with her friends.
As tricky as she is, I still don't fancy her odds on this one.
Keep going or stop for a quick brawl? What do you think, {hero}?
It goes against my better judgment, but let's give her a hand.
Can't say as I ever expected to be rescued by an {arbiter}.
But I'm obliged just the same.
In return, I expect answers.
Ha! I should have known.
I hope this doesn't pose a problem for you.
Nay, I don't owe {rebel-faction} nothin', since they tried to off me. I'll tell ye all I know.
First, I can tell ye I don't know as much as I'd like. I had no idea they were consortin' with demons, fer instance.
What are they up to with the {relics}?
Only the two head cheese types, {rebelleader} and {evilkawa}, know the details. But they claimed to have found a way to be rid of the {council} fer good.
As I understand it, they got what they wanted from three {temples} already. Only the {mapname-kawacity} {temple} remains.
How did the leader of {rebel-faction} get to become a {marked} anyway?
Couldn't rightly say. He said only a {marked} could activate them {relics}, that's why he needed the power.
He must have a sponsor on the {council}. But I can't figure out which {immortal} would want to see the {council} abolished.
Do you know anything about {rebelleader} himself? Who is he?

{rebelleader}'s been the head of {rebel-faction} for the last decade. Very secretive, that one.<page>He's got some trainin', I can tell. I only saw him fight the one time, but he knew what he was about. Kinda like you, I guess.
As much as I enjoy our little chats, I think it's time I be on me way.
While your information was helpful, your crimes are too numerous for me to simply let you go.
Hoho!
Tsk! I see my little trick has outlived its usefulness.

First option: I escort you to the nearest {chapterhouse} and let the dice fall where they may.<page>With crimes including conspiring against the {council}, assaulting an {arbiter}, and murder of a {marked}, execution is the likely outcome.
Ha. I've heard a more enticin' proposal from a drunken {bzil} during matin' season.
Second option.
As a {herorank}, I have the authority to enlist you to my command for a duration suitable to the severity of your crimes. "Suitable" in your case will mean "a very long time."
It's your choice.
There are two ways this can go.
In that case... When do we leave, {herorank}?
So... Can you help her?
I'll need to hear the details first.<page>I find the best decisions are based on facts.
If everyone would adopt such basic scholarly methods, the world wouldn't be such a ruin.
All right, this is what happened...
Fascinating! And you yourself witnessed this nobleman's transformation into a demonic being?
Look, can you help {apprentice} or not?
Tsk, tsk. Please be careful of your tone. Even the implication of violence against my person severely curtails my healing skills.
Yes, I can help her.<page>Fortunately, I am not only the world's greatest healer, but also have extensive experience in what the unwashed call The Dark Arts.
I don't like the direction this is taking.
If you believe yourself in possession of even a fraction of my knowledge and skills, I invite you to try and heal her yourself.
I will fabricate a protective talisman, a powerful amulet to neutralize the dark energies coursing through her.
And this amulet of yours will cure her?
No. Her condition is too critical for an outright cure at this stage.
The amulet will suppress the dark energy for a time... if her strength holds, up to a year I'd say.
And after that?
She'll revert to the state she's in right now. Or degenerate even further. Yes, most likely the latter.
But let's worry about that later. First, I must fashion the amulet to counteract the immediate danger.
This working won't be some parlor trick, mind. The spell will require a certain rare component, an {ancient-bone}.

There is good news amidst the gloom, however! In a nearby graveyard, a burying ground for beasts, I'm sure you will find a specimen.<page>Unfortunately, the graveyard is not the quiet resting place one might hope for. Make sure to bring a few of those oversized scalpels all you {arbiters} seem to favor.
By the by, time is of the essence here.
Got it. Thanks for your help, {necro}.
Please. To heal others has been my lifelong calling.
Ha.
Is this really our best course of action, placing our trust in {necro}?
Considering the speed at which {apprentice} is deteriorating, I think trusting him is our ONLY chance.
Of course. I know you're right. I just...
Wait. Something's not right.
Not a step closer.
What's going on here?
Ye look like a woman of the world. Don't tell me ye've never seen a hostage situation before.
I have hostages and ye, ye have somethin' I want.
I see. Perhaps if you tell us what it is you need, we can come to an agreement.<page>But leave the girl out of it.
Ha! Such concern fer the girlie is touchin' ta be sure. I felt me heart stir in me chest just then.<page>But ye don't seem too worried about the little doc?
I'm simply looking to establish minimally viable terms.
Hoho. Ye're a funny one all right.
Here's what I propose, and it's not up fer negotiatin': you take the girl, I get the {marked}. The doc I gives ye fer free, because of me soft nature.
And what are you planning to do with our {herorank}?
Tut tut. That's me business, and none of yers.
In that case, I regret to say we do have a problem. Because I feel it is very much my business.
Very well, I agree to the exchange.
{color=self}{hero}, by her kit I can tell she's a bounty hunter. There is only one thing she could want you for, and it means this won't end well.
{color=self}I am aware of that. But I don't see a better option.
Enough o' that whisperin'! It's simple enough, "{herorank}": are ye in or are ye not?
As I said, we-
What in the..?
Grrrrh!
This doesn't look good! Are we too late to save her?
One catastrophe at a time! We can worry about the cure once we've got this... thing under control.
Ye know what? I think I'll leave ye to it.
But don't think our business's concluded! Ye can be sure we'll meet again!
Tsk. I hate loose ends.
Forget her. We have to help {apprentice}!
{necro}, we secured the {ancient-bone}. Now can you help her?
I said I would, didn't I? This is the last component. Pass it to me.
It is done.
You two distract her while I slip the amulet over her head.
Now, {necro}!
Do not fret over your friend. She's merely unconscious. But she will need plenty of rest to recover from this trauma.
{necro}, are you all right?
Yes, I'll be fine.<page>But alas, this is what I was afraid of.
Is it too late?
There is still a chance to help her. The amulet should be potent enough to restore her normal self.<page>But there's no way I can complete the spell in the midst of this chaos!
As a side note, I'm out of {monster-cadavers}. I will need fresh corpses in order to summon their assistance.
... Noted.
Watch your step. I spotted one of them laying traps before your arrival.<page>The last thing we need is a severed foot on top of everything else.
{partner}, I know you said you'd kill me if we ever crossed paths again... But it can hardly count if you come all the way to my front door.
Regardless, I won't see you without an appointment. That, you may take up with my attendants.
{necro}, you treacherous bastard! I see nothing's changed. You're still practicing your vile necromancy!
"Vile" is a strong word, my friend. There are two perspectives to all things: the educated one, like mine, and that of grubby buffoons like yourselves.
I'm going to throttle you with my bare hands!
{partner}! Remember {apprentice}.<page>Tell {necro} we pose no threat and that we're not here to indulge your grudge.
{necro}, as much as I wish to rid the world of your sorry kind, that's not why we're here.<page>We have a wounded.
Please pardon me if I don't take your word for it.
You OWE me, {necro}!
You *are* a doctor, right? You have to help us.<page>Our friend was exposed to dark energy, of a kind we've never seen before, and she hasn't regained consciousness since.
Hmm. Dark energy you say? That DOES sound rather interesting...
You, {hero}, I know you're the honorable sort. Give me your word that neither you nor {partner} will cause me any harm, and I will agree to examine your friend.
Know, {necro}, that I share his opinion of you.<page>But you have my word. No harm will come to you by our hands.
Excellent. Please, tell me as much as you can recall about this "dark energy" business while I examine the patient.
{color=self}This must be it.
This way. I think we've found it.
If you seek healing, then indeed you have come to the right place.
A courteous welcome to you, weary travelers.<page>Wait, aren't you..?
I...<page>Oh no.
{color=self}(Sigh). {color=default}That could have gone better.
Hmph. NOW it's going about as well as I expected.
Auggh!
Tsk.
{partner}, are you all right?!
Barely a scratch. I'll be fine.
I love the outdoors as much as the next {arbiter}, but remind me why we couldn't pass the night in a soft bed at {mapname-Temple01-city}'s inn?
We should overtake {lord}'s party by midday tomorrow. I want us to keep a low profile until then.

You're sure you want to do this? I understand the finer points of the law place us in the right, but you're being quite literal about it. I wouldn't be surprised if some of the {immortals} had a problem with it.
Especially whichever one is responsible for nominating that walking pile of dung as a {marked}.
We're doing this.<page>Whatever the outcome, I will take full responsibility before the {council}.
...<page>All right. If that's the way it has to be.
{herotitle}... {hero}, there must have been a mistake! Perhaps a clerical error?<page>I cannot believe anyone on the {council} would choose Lord {lord} as an {immortal} candidate.
What if he is actually selected in the end? It's a terrifying prospect.
I doubt there was any mistake. The timing is too convenient for our lordling. No, this was very deliberate. And I wonder what it portends...
It's futile to pursue this line of thought. Our lot is to ensure the law is respected, not to decipher the motives of the {immortals}.

True. And yet, anyone with eyes can see that conditions have grown steadily worse in recent years.<page>{wardens} skirting their duties without consequence, bandits roaming the lands unpunished, and vulnerable people left unprotected.
As you know, each {arbiter} {herotitle} is fully independent, answering only to the {council}. There isn't much we can do.
There is one thing we can do: ensure the {immortal-council} is not replenished with unworthy candidates, including contemptible, murdering scum.

Well said.<page>Although I'm not certain capturing {lord} will further that goal.<page>As I understand it, a {marked} is quite likely to die or disappear during their Pilgrimage, usually at the hands of other {marked}.
Be that as it may, I witnessed {lord}'s filthy crime firsthand. I'm not leaving anything to chance, especially now that the law is unquestionably on our side.
Hey, {partner}, that pot has been bubbling for quite some time, and the smell...

Ah, yes! You are in luck. Tonight you get to try my wilderness stew!<page>It's from a recipe of my own devising. The secret lies in my method of condensing the different flavors. Come closer to the fire and I'll tell you about the process...
Here we go again.
I wish we had managed to catch Lord {lord} earlier.
Don't trouble yourself about it, {apprentice}. {lord} is cornered. This is the only path in or out of the {temple}.
Now that we have a moment to talk, I wanted to commend you for spotting those additional enemy forces up on the ridge.<page>If we had rushed ahead and gotten flanked, things could have turned ugly.
Thanks, {hero}!
What are we going to do next?

We'll camp here for the night and keep guard over the approach to the {temple}. I don't want to risk him slipping past us in the dark.<page>At first light, we'll strike out for the {temple} and end this once and for all.
What the..?
{Immortal1}?! This is quite a surprise, sir. To what do we owe the honor of your visit?
I wish to speak to the {herotitle}. Privately.
You have always inspired great loyalty in him.
We are family after all.
Yes, now I remember. His parents adopted you at an early age.
Well. Would that I had come simply to engage in idle chit-chat.
The {council} was convened this evening for another surprise meeting, where I was told a {marked} by the name of {lord} was attacked by your group.
There was an altercation earlier today, that's true. I wonder that all news concerning this particular lord travels so quickly.

I took note of that myself, but leave it aside for the time being.<page>I was informed you invoked the {color=term}right of self-defense in the face of mortal danger{color=base} as a means of skirting our earlier prohibition against interfering with any of the {marked}.
An accurate, if creative, interpretation of the law. And from what I know of this {lord}, I have no doubt your claim was justified.
In that case, I confess I do not understand why you are here, {immortal1}.
Ever so direct.

The issue is that while I personally agree with your interpretation of the law, the {council} took a vote and the majority are against it.<page>I am here in my official capacity to "curb your enthusiasm."
However, I wish to propose a different direction for your, uh, zeal.

You must have noticed in recent years how the {arbiters} and the {council} have grown progressively... less effective.<page>{Immortal2}, {Immortal3} and myself have attempted to take things in hand, to correct the current course, but it seems as though our efforts have been constantly stymied.

Though I have been unable to uncover the guilty party hindering our work, the trail circles back to the {council} itself.<page>The protection afforded this unsavory {lord} character is but one more sign that things have gone terribly awry. And I suspect it is part of a greater, more sinister plan.
I understand, {immortal1}. I will support you in whatever course of action you deem best.
Good! I am glad to hear you say that, as I don't think you will particularly like my solution.
{herotitle} {hero}, I have not yet nominated my own {marked}, but I believe I have found just the right candidate.
To have a reliable {immortal} candidate on our side would certainly be welcome.
My thoughts exactly. I need someone who champions doing the right thing above all else. Someone with integrity. Someone incorruptible.
{hero}, I am nominating you to be my {marked} candidate.
Me?!
I am flattered you would trust me with such a grave responsibility.<page>But I must decline. I have no desire to join the ranks of the {immortals}.
I know. And that is another reason why you are so perfectly suited to the task.
I will speak plainly. I sense a growing corruption within the {council}. As you can imagine, rooting out this evil, and quickly, is of the utmost importance.
I need an ally, {hero}.<page>As a {marked}, you will no longer be bound by the law.<page>You will be free to pursue {lord} and investigate the situation in any fashion you see fit.
And once the conspirators are brought to justice, the {council} will have a worthy member to fill the void of {immortal2} stepping down.
There is a certain sense in your plan. But surely there must be someone else, another candidate you could select?
...<page>You are trying my patience, {hero}.<page>I presented this duty in the form of an offer, but no one may refuse the candidacy of a {marked}. Especially not an {arbiter}.
I see. When I became an {arbiter}, I pledged to obey the {immortals} in all things.
I am glad we are finally in accord.<page>Come, come, being a {marked} isn't some kind of curse. You will find yourself even more powerful than before.
It is done. I pronounce you one of the {marked}. I know that you will continue to serve us well.
You are now able to enter the {Temples}, something impossible to anyone but a {marked}, forbidden even to we {immortals}.
The goal of the {marked} Pilgrimage is to visit the four {Temples} and... commune... with the {relics} housed therein.
With the {Mark} upon you, the {Relic} will confer some of its energy to you. Visit the relics at all four {temples} and return to {illuster}.<page>That, in essence, is what the Pilgrimage entails.
Oh, and keep your wits about you during your journey.<page>I have a feeling some skullduggery is afoot within the Pilgrimage, and you don't get to be my age without listening to your hunches.
Now I shall leave you in the care of the worried {partner}.
{hero}, is everything okay? What just happened?
Yes, I'm all right.<page>{Immortal1} selected me to be his {marked} candidate. The magic takes a toll.<page>The feeling is... strange, and not entirely pleasant. But I will get used to it. I must.
Oh.
Indeed.<page>I am going to need some time. To get used to this.
All right.<page>But for now, get some rest. You look exhausted. You can fill me in on the details later.
Now that I am undertaking the Pilgrimage, our new objective is to visit the {temple}.<page>Though I'm sure we'll still have {lord} to deal with on the way.
This is big!<page>You could become one of the {immortals}!
Nothing to do now but wait.
{necro} says she could wake up at any time now.
Don't worry, she's a tough kid. I'm sure she'll bounce right back.
I really hope so.
The girl has regained consciousness.
Young lady, you are under strict instructions to rest.
But I feel fine. Actually, I feel great!
Hmm. Interesting.
But I can't remember anything after the fight against Lord {lord} at the {temple}.
I was told that I went berserk?<page>...and that I even attacked you, {hero}.
I'm so sorry!
Don't worry about it.<page>What's important is that you're all right, Are you sure you should be up so soon after... all that's happened?
On the contrary, I feel wonderful! Overflowing with energy!

This is quite the peculiar case.<page>Even as they are contained by the amulet, the dark energies are making her stronger. For now.<page>Still, the amulet is the only thing maintaining her present form.
The effect won't last forever, though.
Then we need to find a permanent solution.
Indeed.
I need to study one of these {temple} {relics}. One that hasn't been drained of its powers.
Are you suggesting what I think you're suggesting?
As difficult as it is for me to believe, we might be thinking the same thing.<page>Even a broken clock is correct twice a day. You're halfway there now.
Yes, I will accompany you on your Pilgrimage. If you wish to fully restore {apprentice} to herself, it is the only logical course of action.
I must say this phenomenon is quite intriguing!
You-
Easy, {partner}.
I agree. That does sound like our best option. We welcome your help, {necro}.
{apprentice}, you must return to your tent and rest.
But really, I-
That is a direct order.
Yes, {herotitle}!
That must be the {ancient-bone} we're looking for!

Approach the {ancient-bone} with a (not currently swimming) unit and {command-gather} will appear in the action menu.<page>The {command-gather} command is used to collect various {resources} from the land for crafting purposes. Many maps are rich with {resources} to be harvested!<page>Use the "Show Details" button during combat to highlight squares with harvestable {resources}.
We got the {ancient-bone}! This is what we need to help {apprentice}.<page>Let's go!
How odd. That {und-01-title} is clutching an old letter in its fist.
It's that same {und-01-title} with the letter again. We should find a way to stop it from reviving...
A {rang-title} with the right skills could do it.
I believe the collapsed tunnel we're looking for is directly beyond this cave.
We'll have to clear this area before we can proceed, though.
We're running out of time. Hurry!
The explosive device will go off any second now! We have to leave!
We're out of time...
We need to reach the exit in a hurry or the blast will bury us alive.
This is the place the elder directed us to. We need to set the explosive device right here.
I don't like the sound of that.
These weird tremors are going to make setting the device risky.
Listen! I think something's coming.
Unbelievable!<page>We need to eliminate that creature before I can set the explosives!
Better and better.
We'll want to make haste once the charge is set. We should have plenty of time, but the farther away we are when this thing goes off, the happier I'll be!
It is done.<page>Now let's move! On the double!
The elder certainly isn't a {bzil} of half measures.
Be careful everyone! Something big is coming.
That was exhilarating, {herotitle}.
But I also feel a bit sick.
It will pass.
When I was a child, I dreamed of becoming an {arbiter} like my mother.
I also dreamed of fighting alongside her, but never that I would be wearing her armor.
The armor you inherited, but the position you earned.
Watch this one for me, would you?
Yes, {herotitle}.
Why would someone with your wealth and privilege stoop to murder? If that man had wronged you, I'm sure the Court would be happy to hear your case.
The Court's manner of dispensing justice is too costly- er, slow, for my taste.
...<page>I don't understand.
{color=self}(Sigh.){color=base} That shocks me to my core.
But what did he do to you?
Let us just say he strayed from the rut which Fate had gouged out for him.
I still don't-
Just like a pair of little girls I know, he interfered in the business of his betters, and quite soon afterwards paid the price for it.
Perhaps one day you will explain to me how such a powerful lord came to be the prisoner of a pair of little girls.
Hmph.
{apprentice}, you've been looking down in the mouth all morning. Is something the matter?
Just thinking about my mother again, and the path we all chose. So few {arbiters} live to see old age.
That is true, yet the work we do is very valuable. Law and order make good lives possible for people across the land.
Yes, it is important to remember that.
Speaking of your mother, her armor is looking a bit tatty.
Really? What's wrong with it?
With what we've been through, it's taken more than a few knocks, and the straps are worn almost through.<page>You know, there's a blacksmith here in {centina} who owes me a favor.
I would never trade in my mother's armor, whatever its condition!
I'm not going to sell it. Please, just loan it to me for the day. No harm will come to it.
Well... okay. Just for the day.
It's wonderful, thank you {hero}!
Is this what my mother looked like when she went into battle?
It definitely is. You could be her sister.
Wow, you're looking very smart today, {apprentice}. But where did you get the coin for that fancy armor?
It's the same armor I've been wearing all along. The {herotitle} had it refurbished for me!
I can't thank you enough, {hero}.
I'm just glad to see some smiling faces for a change. I have some things to take care of, but I'll see you two at dinner.
{hero} truly is an excellent {herotitle}.
Yes, she did your mother proud. And so do you.

That's kind of you to say... and you're right. My mother would be proud.<page>Every {arbiter} risks their life to serve the {immortals} and enforce the law. My mother paid dearly for that privilege. But she made a conscious choice to serve, just as I have.<page>I understand her better now. I think it is time to let the past be the past.
Speaking of the past, are you and {necro} on speaking terms yet?
Speaking- Ha! That'll be the day.
And you still can't tell me about... whatever crime he committed?
Very well, I will tell you. But I promise your day won't be brighter for hearing it.

My wife, {partnerwife}, was ill, deathly ill. She was being treated at {necro}'s clinic.<page>I had been away on a distant patrol when she fell ill. It was treacherous territory. Weeks passed before I received word, and weeks more passed on the journey home.<page>When I finally arrived, it was too late... She was dead.<page>It was hard. You lost your mother so you know how hard.
...but wasn't {necro} trying to save her life?
Yes, he tried. I'm sure he did his very best.

But when I returned, he had-<page>{necro} wished to study the disease further. That was his reason. When I returned, he-<page>...<page>In order to learn more about the disease that killed {partnerwife}, he brought her back, with his necromancy.<page>My {partnerwife} became one of the cursed attendants he keeps, shambling around his cabin in the woods. That was his crime.
Oh! How terrible. I don't think I can even imagine how that must have felt.

Yes, it was unforgivable. Though, as terrible as it was, it feels good to talk about it.<page>The living should never let death hold sway over them, to darken one's days for so long.<page>And {partnerwife}... I know it's not what she would want for me, this endless brooding over the past.<page>I cannot ever forgive {necro} for what he's done, but hearing you speak of your mother reminds me... time does lend perspective to things.
Mmm, MMM! I've really outdone myself this time!

What a quaint little hamlet.
Well. In any case, good old {quintus} asked me to check up on you. What has been happening, anything of note?
There is much to tell, {primus}...
You've certainly been busy since becoming a {marked}.

Though the events you related are undeniably dire, remember that as a {marked}, your priority is the Pilgrimage. Your duties as an {arbiter} are behind you now.<page>The {council} is investigating all these strange goings-on and will take action as they see fit. You continue with your own mission without distractions.
I will keep that in mind, {primus}.

Excellent. I have always known you to be reasonable.<page>Now, it may be helpful for me to examine young {apprentice}. I have committed no insignificant amount of time to the study of magical energies.
{hero}! The bandits have returned. The town is in danger.
Ah, excuse me, {primus}.
Did you arrive... recently?
More bandits? Didn't we eliminate them on our way here?
I have a theory about that, but let's wait until after we've dealt with this threat to discuss it.
Bandits! And they dare interrupt me on {council} business?!<page>This will not do. No, not at all. Come, {herotitle}. We shall deal with them together.
Really? Are you sure you want to get involved?
I don't mind at all! Honestly, it's a little bit exciting.
Right. Of course, {primus}.
Who is that? It can't be... an {immortal}?!
Yes, I think it is!<page>Do not concern yourself. Our sponsor told us {immortals} cannot directly interfere in mundane affairs.
Yes, right.<page>In that case, let's have it!
{Primus}, I was under the impression {immortals} were forbidden to use their powers without the {council}'s explicit approval.

Correct, {herotitle}. However, since we {immortals} travel so frequently, the {council} does not monitor teleportation magic.<page>It is the misfortune of these rogues that said teleportation leaves them in unsafe areas, I suppose. And all without violating the strictures of the {council}.
That is unsettlingly clever.
{color=self}(I know some of the {immortals} have dubious morals, but for the {council} to vote for {mentor}'s death simply because she revealed some uncomfortable truths...){color=base}
And we work for the {council}. Doesn't that make us complicit?
Who goes there? Show yourself!
Just us, {hero}, and our guilty conscience.
{partner}? You followed me-
As unquestioning servants of the {council}, {mentor}'s death may as well have been our doing.
I don't think I understand. What are you saying?
So you were responsible for my mother's death, {hero}?
{apprentice}! You too..?
Ever do you talk of "law" and "justice", but it turns out you were just as bad as the worst of the {immortals}. Worse, for being their lackey.
No, that's not true! I didn't-
Didn't you?
The burden of all these responsibilities is too heavy for us to bear. Maybe it's time to rest, let someone else take care of it... Before we make it worse.
Ah, there you are, {hero}. Couldn't you hear me calling? I can hardly see my own feet in all this fog.
Over here, {apprentice}! I found her.
Coming!
You've been gone for a while, I was getting-<page>Who in the hells is that?
Isn't that something!<page>I had heard odds are there's someone that looks just like you out there, but this guy is *good*. I mean, he even has my one-of-a-kind, custom-made jacket.
And look, there's another {apprentice} and a second {hero} as well. Impressive.
But what's this? Do I smell the sickly stench of deception?
Come now, {hero}. I understand if your talk with {immortal1} left you rattled, but I'm surprised you'd fall for such a feeble illusion.
I... You're right. I don't know where my head was at.
Thanks, {partner}.
And thank you, {apprentice}.
You two are always there to remind me what's important.
Shadows, I know not from whence you came, but I know exactly where you're headed.<page>Show these specters no mercy!
In that case, let's test your mettle!
Not bad.
Self doubt ill-suits your temperament. Leave them in the wind, stride boldly forward, and follow the path you think right.
That was all passing strange.
I don't understand it either.<page>But it helped me clear my head.

The {council}'s past actions, right or wrong, are irrelevant right now. Our task is to protect the land and its people; that hasn't changed.<page>Our priority is to contain {ancient-beast}, and destroy it if possible. We'll follow our own path and do what we think right.
What happened? It looks like a war was fought here!
As the bearer of the {medallion}, I command thee! You must obey!
{rebelleader}.
What?!
We have company.
Ah. {hero}. Glad you could make it.<page>I didn't have a chance to thank you for your assistance with {primus}.
What have you done, {rebelleader}? What could have possessed you to unleash {ancient-beast}?!

Think about it...<page>{ancient-beast} is so powerful, even the original {immortals} couldn't defeat it.<page>With the beast under my control, I can wipe out the {council} in one stroke! Then we can begin to make this world a better place.
As you've done here in {mapname-city01}?
What happened here was unfortunate, yes, but every revolution requires sacrifices.
I feel as though your claim to control {ancient-beast} was somewhat exaggerated.
I admit it has proven more challenging than we expected. But it's only a matter of time now.

Just how many innocents are you willing to sacrifice to get there?<page>Even should you finally manage to control the monster, it's obvious you can't be trusted with so much power. Frankly, no one can.
Bah! I had hoped you would see reason. A foolish mistake on my part.
Take care of them. I must follow {ancient-beast}.
Is this what {rebel-faction} stands for?
...<page>We've chosen our path. It's too late now to take another. Everyone, to me!
I understand you've got some kind of announcement, {immortal2}? Let's get on with it. If we have to.
Why, yes. Thank you for moving things along, {immortal7}.

As everyone knows, while each of the {council} bears the title of {immortal}, we are not quite as long-lived as that.<page>Every so often in the course of our reign, one of our number is replaced by a younger prodigy.<page>The new {immortal} retains the title of his predecessor and adopts his colors. But he is nevertheless a new {immortal} altogether.
Is this going somewhere?
{immortal7}...
Yes, yes, I know.<page>But important, nay critical, {immortal} business awaits me. Nothing less would tempt me away from this congress, I swear.
Naturally.
As I was saying...
There comes a time for every {immortal} to surrender his mantle and step down.
Now that time has come for me.
That is certainly going to liven things up.
Meaning I will have the opportunity to directly observe an {immortal} relinquishing his power? How absolutely fascinating!<page>Are you quite committed to this decision, {primus}?
As everyone knows, I am the oldest remaining {immortal}, alongside {immortal1}.
I was present on the day we brought down the {color=story}Ancient Beast{color=base}, and I personally scribed the founding tenets of the {immortal-council}.
What I'm getting at is this: it has been a VERY long journey, rewarding yes, but also tiring. And the time has come for me to step down.
Our trusted {arbiter} {herotitles} are no doubt eager to hear what follows. {immortal1}, would you kindly do the honors?
Me..?<page>Yes of course, {primus}.

As this situation only occurs about once a century, it will be a mystery to most of you.<page>When an {immortal}'s time has come, a replacement is selected through a method called the {marked} Pilgrimage.
Every {immortal} marks a candidate of their choosing.<page>The details of the Pilgrimage are explained to the {marked}, but as they are of no import to you, I shall waste no time on that.
What should be of GREAT interest to {arbiters} however, is that each {marked} is an {immortal} candidate, and as such is {color=term}bound by no laws{color=base} for the duration of their Pilgrimage.
You may render assistance unto them if it is requested, but must not otherwise interfere in their business.
I believe that is everything.
Are we done with surprise announcements for today then, {Immortal2}?
Excellent.<page>{herotitles}, you are dismissed.
{immortal2}? Of all people, I would never have suspected you of such treachery. Old friend... why?

Treachery, {immortal1}? Hardly. Our system of governance is flawed, the {council} itself corrupted, and worms like {immortal7} can become {immortals}.<page>What is needed is a single, righteous hand to guide the world, to mold and control it. I will achieve what the {council} has failed to do, what we've always wanted: order.

Have you gone mad, {immortal2}?<page>The {council} was formed to avoid just this sort of situation. The concentration of so much power in the control of a single {immortal} is far too dangerous!<page>You yourself argued that very point, most vehemently, after we bound {ancient-beast} to its prison so long ago.
A regrettable mistake. I should have seized control back then, rather than share it with a group of indecisive fools.

Do you hear what you're saying, old friend?<page>You know the signs as well as I do. The dark energy we have endured for so long is corrupting you from within, breaking down your reason.<page>Is this not why you chose to step down, to finally be rid of this curse? I too am weary of it, old friend. I would not be far behind you...

For a great sage, you were always a bit slow, {immortal1}.<page>I stepped down in order to bring about the Pilgrimage, through which my agents could gain access to the {temple} {relics}.<page>Their vast power I have absorbed already. Only this last remains.
And so you will have amassed every ounce of {ancient-beast}'s power. Are you truly so blind to its corruption? In one way or another, it will destroy you.
No! I control the darkness. I overcame its corrupting influence long ago! I am my own master- It holds no sway- This is all for...<page>The greater good.

Master {immortal2}, we haven't time for this bickering!<page>The others still hope to stop your great plan. You must drain the final {relic} so that we may bring forth the utopia you have worked so hard to achieve!
I... Yes, naturally. Quite right.
You will still have a role in my new world, {immortal1}. You will be my main advisor. Your counsel will be valued. But right now, you must step aside.
No. I am sorry, {immortal2}, but I cannot allow you to do this.
Then, you have called this upon yourself!
You would strike down your oldest friend?<page>I care not for myself, but it pains me to see the greatest of our number fall prey to the corruption.
Be silent!
Ah, {immortal3}. Come to interfere, I see. As always.
And yet more undesired company.<page>Delay our little problem until I finish here, and then I'll take care of it. I will take care of everything.
{immortal1}!
My thanks... {immortal3}... for your most timely intervention.
I fear {immortal2} is... lost to us. He has absorbed... a great deal of {ancient-beast}'s energy. Too much! It has corrupted his mind.
I understand. Rest. We must deal with him now.
{immortal1} is not as strong as he once was. I may be able to save him, if I focus all my energy on healing him. Otherwise...
We cannot lose {immortal1}. Stay here and take care of him.
We will stop {immortal2} and his minions.
It seems I'll need to get involved after all.
You must preserve your strength for what's to come. I will hold them off.
Finally, it is mine! It is all MINE!
You know what to do.
And now to discipline you disobedient children.
Did it work?
No, he's still too strong.
I don't know what your game is, {evilkawa}, but I am more powerful than you can imagine. Nothing you can do will have any effect against me.
But what an odd time to betray me, right after I have become invincible.
{hero}, you must help us defeat him!
Now you want to take him down? What are you playing at, {rebelleader}?
He has absorbed all of {ancient-beast}'s dark energy! Don't you see? Once we have finished him, the {immortals} will be no more!
Something is definitely off here...
But I don't see that we have any other option. {immortal2} must be stopped.
I don't like it, but you're right. We'll need all the help we can get to deal with him.
Fine. Let's take him down together.<page>But don't think you will escape justice afterwards.
{immortal2}, there's still time to come to your senses!
He can't hear you from the other side of the barrier. Nothing will interrupt him until he is finished, when he has absorbed the last of {ancient-beast}'s power.

This was your plan to replace the {council}? Imbue {immortal2} with absolute power?<page>You are a {marked}, as I am. You know the effects of the dark energy we carry. With all {immortal2} has absorbed, can't you see it will drive him mad?
It is slightly more complicated than that.<page>As you soon shall see!
Why..? How is this happening?
I do not understand. I was... all-powerful.
{evilkawa}! Now!
My ancestor's work is at last complete!
I leave... the rest... to you, {rebelleader}.
No! What is happening?
What... have you done?!
Ancient beast! I bear the {medallion}! The very talisman used to summon you long ago!
By its power, you must obey my commands!
Hmm. Unfortunate.
I don't know what this means, but I think I have a new definition for "worst-case scenario."
What was that terrible creature?!
Something I had hoped never to see again. That was {ancient-beast}.
The {kawa} elders told us it had been sealed away, but until now I still had my doubts.
We were unable to fully defeat it.
You're in no condition to move yet! You should rest.
Thank you my dear, but I'm feeling much better. Thanks in large part to your kind ministrations.
Although the great resilience granted to us by {ancient-beast}'s energy played a part as well.
Wait, is that the real reason you imprisoned {ancient-beast}? In order to drain its energy and become all-powerful {immortals}?!
{partner}, please don't be daft.<page>Our powers were an unforeseen byproduct of periodically draining {ancient-beast}'s dark energies. Which was necessary to keep it from breaking the seal.
But why did you seal it away in the first place? You always claimed to have defeated it.
Truthfully... we proved insufficient to the task. It was impossibly strong.
That's why it was necessary to bind it to the {relics}.<page>We knew we must continuously siphon its power to keep it in check. And that it would take a toll on us, a severe toll.
A very extended lifespan doesn't seem like much of a toll to me.

Ah, I see that {hero} understands me.<page>As a {Marked}, absorbing all that dark energy places a great strain on one's mind. Nay, on one's very being.<page>That corruption will eventually become too much to bear. That is the reason {immortals} relinquish their position in the end.
And we have all witnessed what it did to my friend, {immortal2}...
It appears we must seal the beast away again. How did you do it the first time?
It wasn't easy.<page>The {kawas} helped. They have a greater understanding of summoning magics.
They probably did so to assuage their guilt!<page>It was the {kawas} who summoned {ancient-beast} to begin with.
The gentle little {kawas}? Why would they do such a thing?!
We were at war with the {kawas} at the time, and the {humans} were prevailing.<page>This summoning was their trump card. A bold gambit, but foolhardy.
In exchange for their assistance, and to help preserve order, we erased their involvement with {ancient-beast} from history.
Although as a precaution, the {council} has never allowed one of their number to become an {immortal}.
I see.<page>Could we simply ask the {kawas} to help us as they did before?
I doubt that will be possible. The {council} initiated a very strict prohibition on {kawa} summonings, so by now the art is probably lost to them.
That {evilkawa} fellow sure seemed to have a handle on it.
Hmm, true. He was a direct descendant of the original summoner who opened the gate for {ancient-beast} to enter {worldname}.<page>Perhaps he found an ancient text written by his ancestor.
But we can consider requesting {kawa} assistance later.<page>The most important component for the Sealing Ritual is the original token used to summon {ancient-beast}.
{rebelleader}'s {medallion}.
Precisely. It had been missing for decades. I can only assume that {rebelleader} stole it when he left the {arbiters}.
All right, where does that leave us?
I will-
YOU will remain in {illuster} and help restore order to the city. You need to rest, {immortal1}!
...<page>You're right, of course.
As has so much before, the task will fall to you and your companions, {hero}.
First, track down {rebelleader} and retrieve the {medallion}. It is our only chance at sealing {ancient-beast} away again.
From what I've seen, the world is ready for new heroes. I know you won't disappoint, {herotitle}.
We will get it done, {immortal1}. You have my word.
I'm not yet convinced of your motives. Tell me again why you want to stop {immortal2}.
With all the {relics} drained, we have a chance to be rid of the dark energy that has been sustaining the {immortals} since the {council}'s inception.
The {immortals} had {ancient-beast}'s energy sealed for a reason.
Yes, to gather that power to themselves! Dark energy has been sustaining them and their rule for centuries!
And what's {evilkawa}'s role now? Where has he gone to?
He's preparing a massive blow, to end {immortal2} once and for all.
Let's focus on doing our own part.
Hmph. A good attempt, but you're merely chipping away at an invincible being.
How many times must we bring him down?!
I'm almost done! Just do your part, and keep him busy a little longer.

How like an {arbiter} to align yourself with the weak and stupid. Your order is the epitome of the {council}'s malfeasance.<page>From now on, I alone shall be the one to mete out justice in the realm.
You are no longer fit for your position, {immortal2}. For the sake of all that is right, I cannot allow you to continue on this path.
How trite. But there exists no authority higher than mine.
I know how important a unified strategy is on the battlefield, so consider me at your disposal until this is over.
I can hear voices coming from down below. We don't have much time now if we're planning to block that trapdoor.
Demons?! Out here?<page>We can't allow them to run loose. We need to eliminate them, now!
Demons roaming the countryside! How did this ever come to pass?!
The timing is certainly suspicious. This has to be related to {immortal2} and {rebel-faction}.
It's as you feared, {hero}.
It looks as though they came straight from the Capital.<page>I don't know what's going on in {illuster}, but it can't be good if demons are pouring out of it.
All the more reason to hurry.<page>Let's go.
{Hero}...
Yes, I noticed.
What's happening, {herorank}?
Stand back, {apprentice}.
Spotted. Ah, well. You {wardens} are every bit as sharp as they say.
But much friendlier. Well met, friend!
{color=self}(Sigh){color=base}
If you have business with us, out with it. Otherwise, step aside.
Of course, I will make it quick for you. Hand over that nobleman traipsing along at your heels, and everyone else can be on their merry way, safe and sound.
Quiet.
Safety and soundness first, exactly my own philosophy! But first, tell me: just what is it you want with our bejeweled guest?
What a splendid idea!
Funny you should ask. From what I've been hearing lately, I bet you {wardens} wouldn't mind a taste of this action yourselves, eh?

All right, here it is: this rich fop will pay us handsomely for his freedom.<page>Hand him over and 20% of the fee is yours to divide amongst yourselves. No one need ever know an {warden} was involved in our little transaction.<page>I get what I want, you get paid, and your reputation remains as spotless as {illuster}'s peaks.<page>Win-win-win. Is there a fourth "win" I'm missing?
Well, what do you say? Do we have a deal?
I dunno, {hero}. Only 20%?
{herorank}..?
Enough.
We haven't the time to exchange banter with these fools.

As for you lot... Attempted bribery, intimidation, interfering in {warden} business.<page>Serious crimes, the kind that should see every one of you decorating the trees. But get out of our way and I'll forget I ever saw your faces.<page>That is my final and only counteroffer. Signal that you accept, before I change my mind.
Tch! Of all the doomy luck, we just had to run into the one clean {warden} within a hundred leagues!
Jump lively boys! It looks like we must earn our prize today. No survivors, no witnesses!
{hero}, mark you that sizeable trap door? I think they might have reinforcements waiting below.
Well spied. If one of us stands directly upon it, that should keep it sealed against any new enemies.
Agreed. But we must move quickly if we plan to secure it. They could strike at any moment.
This used to be an inn, quite a prosperous one if I remember aright.
Burned down in a marauder attack last year.
And no {wardens} nearby to prevent it.
You allude to that scoundrel's claim about {wardens} taking bribes. Nothing but a desperate attempt to talk their way out of a fight. I don't believe a word of it.
And yet here we are, dragging that foppish nobleman around because we can't quite trust the local {chapterhouse}.
I'll make sure everyone is ready.
That's a long enough break. We need to keep moving if we're to reach {map-ImmortalCity} before nightfall.

Special events that happen during combat will display an event icon in the turn order list at the top of the screen.<page>When the event icon comes to the front of the turn order, the event will trigger.
{apprentice}, why don't I give you a quick refresher on {items}?
{items} don't work as they usually do in most games, so you probably shouldn't skip this tutorial.
The way forward is clear, my lord.
Excellent! The {temple} is close, I can sense it.
Lord {lord}, sir!
Yes, what? Spit it out, man!
Your lordship asked to be notified if any of them interpoler... interlopters... them "intruders" showed up.
They have done showed, sir!
I am again amazed at my ability to communicate with lesser lifeforms, especially the incoherently babbling kind.
No, not you lot! Again?!
Tsk. I suppose that band of buffoons I sent to deal with you have bungled it.<page>Never send a common thug to do a nobleman's work, that's the lesson here.
Yes, I most certainly did. How embarrassing for them, to have fallen to your feeble little band of ne'er-do-wells.
And now what, wench? Your precious law forbids you from so much as barring my path.<page>Or are you planning to BORE me to death?
Don't think I'll let you off so easily though. I believe it is past time you were taught to respect your betters.
Oh yes, I am going to savor this, my dear. I am going to put you down like the cur you are.
Lord {lord}. Fancy that, the two of us crossing paths out in the hinterlands.
Then you freely admit to contracting a group of brigands to kill us?
I was hoping you would say that.

I hereby invoke the {color=term}right of self-defense in the face of mortal danger{color=base}, bestowed by law upon all {arbiters}!<page>"Whilst their life is at risk, {arbiters} have the right to defend themselves under any circumstances, against any foe", even be they {immortals} or... {markeds}.
Wait... what? What is this law?!<page>That's not how it was supposed to be!<page>I...
Hmph!<page>I haven't time to spar with my lessers.
Underlings, I shall proceed to the {temple}. Remove the interlopers for me.
Was it ridiculous of me to think he might stay and fight?
There are more of them up on the ridge as well, {herotitle}.
Well spotted, {apprentice}. It appears we must go through his henchmen to get to {lord}.
Why is it so quiet?
I don't know, but I don't like it. Stay alert. Something is definitely off.
Told ye we'd be meetin' again, didn't I? It tuckers a girl out ye know, bein' right all the time.
I like this meeting better already. You don't have a hostage to hide behind.
Ha! Funny girl. I just knew there was somethin' I liked about ye.
What does {rebel-faction} want with us this time?
Ye figured it out, eh? Yeah, I'm with {rebel-faction}. My task is to keep any {marked} from completin' the Pilgrimage. That's why I'm here, to see that ye drop out o' the quest.
I saw ye helpin' folks in {mapname-oasis01} and {mapname-town2}. I can tell ye're a good sort. A woman o' principles 'n all that.
Here's me deal: swear to me ye'll abandon the Pilgrimage and that'll be that.<page>Easy peasy, wasn't that breezy.
An interesting proposal. Here is my counteroffer.
For the crimes of kidnapping, ransoming, and attempted murder, the law allows your capture, dead or alive.<page>You surrender peacefully and we'll make that "alive."
Hoho! Perhaps ye've got a titch too many principles, at that.
I suppose we do it the hard way, then.
And, don't think ye'll be surprisin' me with yer weirdly demon powers this time, little miss!
{color=self}I knew it was too quiet. They were in position before we even got here, and now we're surrounded. Do you have a plan?
{color=self}She's obviously the leader. Take her down quickly and I bet the rest will scatter fast enough.
Righty-ho, y'all, this is no bunch o' lightweights! No quarter, no how!
Hmm... Once again, my apologies.
Unnecessary. {arbiters} are meant to protect citizens, not the other way around.
I did notice some locals taking part in that ambush.
Hmm... Yes. If they had assistance from {bzils}, it would explain how a band of outsiders could set up an ambush without anyone noticing.<page>After all, most of us live in caves under the city.
But why would {bzils} help {rebel-faction} with their dirty work?!
Hmm... Members of {rebel-faction} have been very active in {mapname-desert01} for some years now.
Discontent with the rule of the {immortals} has been growing, especially among our younger generations.
But what specifically is their complaint?
Hmm... Many things. But the biggest issue is the prohibition on arming our own guards, forcing us to rely on {arbiters} for our safety.
I understand your concerns, elder.<page>I promise you, if I can at all influence {Council} policies, I will make it a priority to improve relations with your people.
Which brings me to the reason for our visit: we require access to the {sealed-temple}.
Hmm... The {sealed-temple}. Yes, of course...
Hmm... I'm afraid this is going to be difficult.
{color=self}(Sigh){color=base} What's difficult about it?
Hmm... When news reached us of the {marked} coming here for the Pilgrimage, a few {rebel-faction} sympathizers flooded the {sealed-temple}.
They flooded it? How is that even possible?

Hmm... Living underground, we {Bzils} are quite knowledgeable about tunnel networks and reservoirs and such things.<page>We believe {rebels} diverted the flow of an underground river, raising the water level until the entire {temple} was submerged.
The whole thing underwater. That's unfortunate.
Hmm... Agreed, and there's worse news: the water level is so high, it is putting our entire harvest at risk.
How irresponsible.
Hmm... Quite.
Hmm... We have, however, come up with a solution which would restore the water to its previous level, save our harvest, and grant you access to the {sealed-temple}.
I get the feeling this solution requires us to do the heavy lifting.

An explosive device must be placed under the lake, by the blockage created by the members of {rebel-faction}.<page>The resulting breach will release the floodwaters and, hmm... water levels should quickly return to normal.
But?
Hmm... But. Hmm... The tunnels are infested with monsters, and as you well know, my people are not warriors.
We understand the situation, elder.<page>As {arbiters}, it is our duty to assist, even if we didn't need access to the {sealed-temple}.

Hmm... Would that all {arbiters} were as dutiful as you, young one.<page>There was another group of {arbiters} here recently. Their leader, a {herotitle} {arbiterleader1}, advised us to petition the {council} for assistance.<page>Hmm... I do believe we'd lose our harvest before receiving a response.
Hmph! How lazy!
That particular group of {arbiters} has already been... reprimanded.
Hmm... That is good to hear. Perhaps I have grown too cynical in my elderhood.
Do be careful in the tunnels. I have heard tell that some of the beasts down there may be... larger than normal.
Thank you for the warning, elder.
All right, let's get this done.
Ye're all tougher than ye look!<page>I'll be seein' ye!
She does a nice job of getting away.
Tsk. We'll be ready for her tricks next time.
Beware of those huge beetle-like creatures.<page>They appear to be lumbering and slow, but can charge a great distance across open ground to attack, and pack a mean wallop when they do.
Make use of these columns and ruins to deny them a clear path to charge.
Monsters again. This place sure is lively!
They look occupied. Maybe they'll let us pass by.
Let's make sure a helpless traveler isn't what's occupying them.
Isn't that {kawamerchant}?
It is! We have to help the little one.
Little friend! I see you've gotten yourself into trouble again.
Kind {arbiter} and friends!
I is glad to see friends! Very glad!
Don't worry, little one, we'll protect you!
Human roads very dangerous!

I not lost! I is on way to {mapname-kawacity}.

Big thanks to kind {arbiters}!
{arbiters} come meet I at shop in {mapname-kawacity}!

{Hero}!

KILL. CONSUME.

That settles it.
You can come out now, everyone!
Ye on board with us after all, lass? Ye cannae bear any longer t' be ruled over by a gaggle of old folks with naught but a demon 'tween their ears, can ye?
The {Council}... it sentenced my mother to death. It forced {Partner} into that horrible choice. And now, it's poisoning {Hero}'s mind.

There has to be a way.

A dozen centuries of {Immortal} rule, over.
A pretty good run all in all, I'd say.

As de facto interim ministers, {Immortal1} and I must establish a new system of governance for the land.<page>Before all hell breaks loose.
{Immortal2} was always the one who excelled at these things, before the corruption took his mind.
No use dwelling on that, though.
{Arbiters}. {Immortal3} is right about what is to come.
I realize that you've done so much for the realm already... not to mention that an ex-{Immortal} can hardly claim authority over you.

How exciting!

I take it by yer unbloodied blades that ye di'n't lend an ear to me friendly advice, then?

The slightest spark can ignite a war, right now.
Aye aye, {HeroTitle}.
Umm... I don't agree with {Hunter}'s "friendly advice," {Hero}, but... she does have a point buried in there.
Are {Immortal1} and {Immortal3} really the best people to lead us right now?

I know {Immortal1} is a good person and all... He did vote against my mother's death sentence. But he won't be around much longer.<page>And he did help set up the {Council} and {Marked} Pilgrimage in the first place, which got us all into this mess.

Old dodderers who've had naught but a demon 'tween their ears for too long, the lot o' them.

I do share some of your concerns, {Apprentice}. {Immortal3}'s evasiveness is deeply unsettling.<page>But she and {Immortal1} are still our best option for keeping the peace at the moment.<page>At the end of the day, that's what being an {Arbiter} is all about, isn't it?
{color=self}(Hm. Nothing has changed while I've been away.){color=base}<page>{color=self}(No fresh vandalism. Surprising.){color=base}
{color=self}(But nothing will be the same again.){color=base}
{color=self}(If I can isolate the restorative properties of the {color=story}Ancient Beast {color=self}Essence...)
{color=self}(Yes. I can think of no nobler pursuit than extending life and health for those who are deserving. {Immortals} will monopolize that gift no more.){color=base}
Oh good, more bandits. You can hardly walk down the road without tripping over them. Has it always been this bad?
The Pilgrimage has made things worse. The {arbiters} have been stretched thin dealing with the chaos in the {markeds}'s wake.
On the bright side, once your Pilgrimage is complete you'll be in a position to do something about it.
Thanks, {partner}.
What's this? A group of trespassers, traipsing down our road careless as you please.
C'mon, fellows! There's still time for a bit of fun before the big job. Kill them all and we'll split the loot when we're done!
Bold of you. I don't meet many bandits willing to challenge a full company of {arbiters}.
A full... company?<page>Well, I'll be...
Ah, whatever. You lot go on ahead. Doubt you're worth our time anyway. But be quick about it, and stay out of the way.
You're not serious, I hope. You just ordered your men to butcher us.
{color=self}I don't think we're dealing with the sharpest knife in the block here.
And then I changed my mind, didn't I? You can save your thanks. I just don't need any of the trouble that seems to follow {arbiters} everywhere they go.
Well, trouble is what you've got. Surrender or we will pass judgment on you here and now.
You, threatening me? Ha!<page>I gave you every chance to leave with a whole skin. Back to the first plan, everyone!
Where they're standing I want to see a field of corpses, or a forest of them. Oh, you know what I mean.<page>Slay them all!
This is the problem with criminal organizations. No standards.
I'm surprised he survived that blow. And disappointed. That thick head's good for something after all, eh?
What should we do with him?
It is inconvenient, but I won't strike down an unarmed man, especially one in his state.<page>We'll take him to the nearest {arbiter} {chapterhouse}. They can decide his fate.
The closest is {mapname-town2}, but the {chapterhouse} there is too small to take prisoners.
Then he travels with us for the time being. Or he would if he was able to walk.
{necro}, is there anything you can do to get him in marching condition?

Oh, certainly I could do *something* for him, if I were inclined, say if he had an interesting or incurable disease.<page>But the variety of lacerations, contusions and traumas plaguing this man are of no interest to me whatsoever.
But I thought you were a famous doctor. Aren't doctors supposed to treat anyone in need?
I am not a simple country doctor, nor am I a veterinarian or a witch. My healing gift is dispensed only to the deserving or the interestingly afflicted.<page>That man is neither.
I see.
Halloo, fellow {arbiters}!
I am {herorank} {arbiterleader1}. And you are {herorank} {hero}, yes?
Well met, {ArbiterLeader1}. It is gratifying to meet fellow {arbiters} on the road.<page>What brings you to this area?

I've heard about your reputation for directness. I like it.<page>We are on patrol, simply looking out for anyone in need. And clearing the roads of filth when we find it.<page>I heard also about your new {marked} status. I'm surprised you took time away from the Pilgrimage to sort out this riffraff.
Thinking us helpless travelers, this scum was planning to put our entire group to the sword for no better reason than robbery.
Such flagrant villainy is not something I am willing to let pass.
I understand completely. No {arbiter} worth their salt would allow his type to run free.
But now this blackguard has burdened you with another problem. {mapname-town2}'s {chapterhouse} cannot accommodate prisoners.<page>And I'm sure you want to return to your Pilgrimage.
Why don't we take him off your hands?
That would be much appreciated.
It is no more than my duty.
Get him ready for travel.
We'll be on our way, then.
I am glad to have met you, {herotitle} {hero}. I wish you the best of luck on your Pilgrimage.
And a good journey to you and your team, {herotitle} {arbiterleader1}.
How fortuitous!
It seems to be, doesn't it?
That skirmish cost us valuable time. Let's get moving. We'll stop at {mapname-town2} to resupply, and then on to the next {Temple}.
Have you and {hero} visited the {kawa} lands often?

And this has left them without much {arbiter} protection compared to other cities.
Which is why {hero}'s always made it a point to check on the area from time to time.
Even though she downplays it, she's actually quite trusted by the {kawa} elders.
That does sound like {hero}.
You give valuables. Then leave!
That's not the welcome I thought we'd be getting.

There's an awful lot of them, though, and I wouldn't be surprised if even more of them were on their way. They do like their swarms...<page>If we're to catch up to {rebel-faction}, I think our best plan is to rush ahead.
Agreed.<page>Let's make a run for those lifts ahead.
Bad luck that, crossing paths with wild beasts.
Everyone be on guard! {vangals} are quite agile, and in their own way just as dangerous as a seasoned warrior.
I can't believe it! She's real. That sketchy rumor you overheard must have been true after all.
Though locket or no locket, she doesn't seem thrilled to see us.
Nice work, {apprentice}.
Thank you, {herotitle}! My training is proving its worth, just as you said it would.
I confess I am impressed at the progress you've made in very short time.<page>But once again, please address me by my name. I prefer that we relax protocol while in the field.
Yes, of course, uh, {hero}.
Ready to report my findings, Madam {herotitle}! I await your convenience.
{partner}, you're insufferable.
Alas, I am a man of many flaws, Madam {herotitle}.

Aww... You know me too well.

Excellent work, {Partner}.<page>Coupled with the thugs confirming that they were in {lord}'s employ, this should be ample evidence against him.
All right, you two take a breather. I'll ready everyone for our departure for the {temple} near {mapname-temple01-city}.
Uh, {partner}? I'm not sure I followed that whole exchange.

It's hard to tell by looking at her, because she keeps her emotions so carefully in check, but...<page>{hero} is actually very angry, and concerned. Does anyone doubt where THIS came from?

Ah, the {herotitle} is so wise.
So that is the reason we've been heading towards {mapname-temple01-city} this whole time? Knowing the lord was going that way himself, {hero} was seeking retribution.

There is no way the woman I know would ever let this go.
All right, we've had our break. Let's rejoin the group.

...<page>Fair point.

If we fell enough of these creatures, the crystal should reawaken. And then we can use it to proceed onward.

{apprentice} needs a break. The journey here has been much harsher than what I would typically expect of a trainee.

Wait, what's this?

Spread the word: we leave tomorrow at first light for {mapname-Temple01-city}.

{herotitle}!
Finally, a friendly face amidst this chaos!

Yes, {herotitle}! I will see our city reclaimed from these horrors, or die in the attempt!
{goodarbiter}, you're safe!
{herotitle} {hero}, it is good to see you and your team safe.
And you and your men as well, {herotitle} {hero}.

Your pride at being {immortal2}'s lackey surprises me not one whit, {immortal7}.<page>If you do not stand down at once, you will be forced aside.

{immortal2}, the {rebel-faction} leader, and his pet {kawa} are all waiting ahead.<page>You'd best make sure you and yours are ready, {herotitle}.

I could tell you it was all part of the plan. That sowing chaos left and right was a sure way to keep {arbiters} from meddling with our {temple} business.<page>But I'd be lying. You are a sick, sick man.
Please, {immortal5}, it's not too late to do the right thing. If we combine our forces, we can still stop {primus}!

{immortal1} is guarding the {relic}, but I don't know how long he'll last by himself. We have to hurry!

I don't think you've thought this through, my dear. Even if you could succeed in stopping {immortal2}, how long do you think you will last after that?<page>You must already feel the darkness growing heavier, with one of our number dead. Ah, {hero}, good to see you.
{immortal1}.<page>I'm glad to see you're doing better.
{immortal3} has been doting over me like a {vangal} pup.<page>But with every other {immortal} dead and {immortal4} vanished from the face of {worldname}, I'm already growing tired again...
In any event, you're not here to listen to the complaints of an old man. What can I help you with, {hero}?
We have recovered the {medallion}.
That's the first good news I've heard in days! Containing the chaos in the city has been- But never mind that.
You must visit the {kawas} and hope that enough of their ancient lore survives to tell us how to once again imprison {ancient-beast}.
We've met with them already. They told us how to handle the beast.
Ah, excellent!<page>Was there something else you needed? Time is of the essence.
Yes, actually. I wanted to ask you about {mentor}.
Ah, your old mentor, {mentor}. I'm not surprised you have questions.
{rebelleader} said the {council} sent her on a suicide mission, deliberately, in order to be rid of her. Is that true, {immortal1}?
It *is* true.
I'm sorry, {hero}. I did what I could but... I was unable to sway the {council}.

{mentor} had been vocal about certain {immortals} abusing their authority. I'm sure you can guess which ones.<page>The {council} feared her popularity. If she were to reveal what she knew, it would bring disorder, even call our rule into question.
I did not see it that way at all. Her loyalty was unquestionable. But I couldn't convince them. It was a great shame.
But you went along with their plan, sent her to die on a hopeless assignment.
...<page>You know the protocols of the {council}. My vote weighed no more nor less than any other.
At least it was not entirely in vain. The {council}'s more troublesome elements were reined in, for a time, in order to preclude any other such unfortunate compromises.
That's all {mentor}'s life amounted to in the end? An unfortunate compromise for the {council}.
Now, that's not what-
I need to think on this.
Thank you for your time, {immortal1}.
We're headed to {mapname-kawacity01} next.
Tell me, {arbiterleader1}, what pushed you to betray the {arbiters}?
Hmph. You saw who's in charge. Does it look like I had a choice?
I think you were selected because you have a taste for criminal activities. I doubt anyone in my outfit would have received such an offer.
Bah, I've had enough of your lectures!<page>You will be dealt with, I promise. Then we'll pin all the attacks on a {marked} {arbiter} gone crazed with her newfound power!

We followed one of the bandits here after disrupting their plan to attack {mapname-oasis01}.
Really?! How did one of these lowlifes manage to escape your grasp?

What a lucky break for me!
How many times have you failed me already, {arbiterleader1}? And now you allowed yourself to be followed.
But {immortal7}, as I reported, every one of these mishaps is the fault of {banditleader1}!

Stow that drivel, you jumped-up squire! It was {arbiters} what kept showing up and attacking us every time we turned our backs!<page>And where were you lot? Your only task was to keep those curs off our trail!
If I didn't have a mob of incompetents to babysit-
ENOUGH!

Aha, found them! And some of their playmates as well.
That can't be... {immortal7}?!
Gods, what now?!
One of you buffoons was followed again!<page>And by a {marked}, this time!
I don't have time for this nonsense. Deal with them as well, and you had better be thorough this time.<page>If any one of them survives, you'd best be certain you do not.
{hero}, a welcome sight as always! Perhaps we can catch up later.
{goodarbiter}, I can't say I expected to find you here.
These days it seems like I'm mandibles-deep in one secret investigation after another. This time it's corrupt {arbiters}.
I do believe I just uncovered some conclusive evidence.
{herotitle} {hero}, we meet again!
{arbiterleader1}.
Come come, don't look at me like that. Everything can be explained.
Still your weasel tongue! We've already seen what your negotiating gets us.<page>We're putting this hunting dog down once and for all, and you're going to help.
Fine.<page>But later on, you and I are going to have a little talk about respect, {banditleader1}.
Front and center, everyone! You know the drill, no survivors!
My thanks again for the rescue.<page>That's twice now you've saved my thorax with your excellent timing.
Always a pleasure, {goodarbiter}.
What's next?
If {immortal7} is the leader of those bandits, we have to report this to the {council} at once!
I don't fancy sending anyone alone to report this. And {immortal2} made it clear the {council} wants us to focus on the Pilgrimage.
We'll report to the {council} once the Pilgrimage is over. {illuster} is at the end of our journey anyway.

{immortal7} mentioned a big operation planned in the {kawa} lands. Since that's the final leg of your trip, we should at least keep our eyes open.<page>Anything useful we can discover will mean a more thorough report to the {council}.
We?
Well, since our objectives align, I thought we might as well team up. Perhaps if we travel together, you won't need to swoop in and save my chitinous bottom quite so often.
A compelling argument.
All right. Welcome aboard, {goodarbiter}.
It's settled then!
{partner}, we must have a feast to celebrate our new partnership! Get cooking, friend!
I'm already regretting this.
I don't like our odds, little friend.
Stay behind me. I'll keep you safe for as long as I can.
I is very grateful to kind {arbiter}!<page>I is able to help. Many potions!
Wild beasts are threatening those travelers! We have to help before they're torn apart!

Is that a group of {arbiters} I see? We're saved!<page>Huh. That one with the strange, glowing sign on her face must be a {marked}.<page>Sigh. It is at least better than encountering more bandits. I think.
I think our odds may have improved slightly, little friend. We might just get through this yet!
Yes, Mister {arbiter}!
Is that you, {hero}? I hadn't quite recognized you with your new, uh, facial... {mark}... there. On your face. Obscuring one half.<page>...<page>That didn't come out quite right.
...<page>{goodarbiter}, always good to see you. Save your usual chatter for when we've dealt with the immediate threat.
As always, I love the way you think.
Oh, and I believe the expression you're looking for is "your usual chitter."
{hero}, is that a {kawa} beside {goodarbiter}?
Yes. You've never met their kind before?

Not surprising. They are a reclusive race and in general only the merchants venture beyond their own lands.<page>Although occasionally some rogue {kawas} turn to banditry. Just as with our kind, sadly.

Banditry does seem to be a popular pastime throughout the lands.<page>In any event, don't be fooled by their simplistic dialect. Their merchants are incredibly shrewd, and never settle a deal without the upper hand.
I see. We should hurry and save him then!
Thank goodness for your timely assistance!<page>I fear my little friend and I came very close to ending up as dinner.
Thank you to kind {arbiters}!
It was our pleasure, friends. How did this little one end up out here in the wilderness?
I believe my merchant friend here took a wrong turn outside {illuster} and ended up getting rather too close a look at the wildlife.
{Human} roads is very confusing!
Uh huh.
What about you, {goodarbiter}? I'm guessing you're on your way to the {temple}?

Excellent!
Let's get going!
By the by, is good old {partner} still acting as your personal chef?
Sigh. Now I must endure the both of you at the same time.

Let's just say your {mark} is giving me an idea about what awaits at the end of the journey. And this time...

The portal is reacting to the {color=story}{key-boss}{color=base}!
Here goes nothing!

{herotitle} {hero} always welcome in {mapname-kawacity}!

Friends! It is good to catch sight of you again.
{arbiter} {partner} has told us you come with questions on how to seal Ancient Beast.

{immortal1} is most certainly correct that {ancient-beast} cannot be defeated.<page>Such big summoning as Ancient Beast would have created permanent connection between {worldname} and {ancient-beast}'s terrible realm.<page>Even if beast's physical form were defeated, beast life energy would retreat to home realm and regenerate.<page>After short span, beast would return to {worldmapname} to terrorize all again.

But, if there was something, it would be connected to {mapname-highlands02}, where {ancient-beast} was summoned, long ago.
Just a guess at this point, though.

All right everyone. This is our most important duty yet. Prepare yourselves.
Well... There *might* be another way.

That's it?! Where I'm from, the elders would insist we gather a wagonload of ancient artefacts before trying to take down such a beast.

We would accompany you, but I fear we're a little past our prime. And fighting was never strong suit to begin with.

Defeating {ancient-beast} will be our first step, regardless. We'll see how things play out from there.
All right everyone, we know what we must do. Let's get to it!
Ah, {herotitle} {hero} and her friends! It is good to catch sight of you again.
We have been looking into another way of dealing with the beast, so that no one needs to... So that it can be disposed of for good.
Find anything interesting?
These must be the beasts the elders warned us about.
I've never seen their like before. Best be on guard.
I'm not thrilled about all this lava either. I doubt anyone -or any *thing*- could survive a swim in that.
The {rebels} are waiting inside.<page>I don't know what their intent was in draining the {relics}, but whatever they're doing, it's dangerous, and a threat to the {council}.

Everyone, be ready for the fight of your lives. Between {rebelleader}, {evilkawa}, and their minions, these are going to be the strongest enemies we've ever faced.
Our plan is on the cusp of success. You won't stop us now!
Your "plan." Do you mean your intention to unleash the ancient beast that nearly tore {worldname} asunder when last it was summoned?
Uh huh. Great plan.
Our leader is more powerful than the beast or the sorcerers of old. He can control it. With the creature on our side, we will finally be able to change things for the better!
I see. You intend to replace the very {council} you so despise, but with a bigger cudgel to enforce your rule.
I don't have to listen to the drivel of those who don't share our bright vision!<page>Everyone, it is time to eradicate these lapdogs of the old order. For the cause!
Demons! I bear the {medallion} that controls your master. You WILL obey me!
Good.
I don't know that he could control {ancient-beast} itself, but he's certainly getting better at it.
If there's even a chance he can master {ancient-beast}, we must intervene and stop him now.<page>Who knows what havoc he could wreak with that monster at his beck and call!
You again.

But you simply will not stop.
I can't let you do as you please using {ancient-beast} as your personal weapon.<page>And you have much to answer for.
Then let's end this now.<page>I cannot afford the distraction of you nipping at my heels when I finally gain control over {ancient-beast}.
How... foolish of me.

Whatever you do... you must stop the Ancient Beast... At all costs... It will... corrupt... every...thing.
He's gone.
Even with all the wrong he has done... Somehow I am still saddened.
...<page>I understand, {apprentice}.
{mapname-oasis01} is ours! Loot everything you can!<page>Slay any that get in the way, but only if they're in the way! Remember that we're here for business, not sport!

How in the world did he get free?
Never mind. Right now, we have to help the townsfolk.
We need to figure out the source, how they're able to keep mounting regular attacks.<page>I'm going to fall back and investigate. Handle this one without me.
It's over, {banditleader1}. There's nowhere for you to go.
In that you are mistaken.
Always so cocksure of yourselves, aren't you? You {arbiters} are all the same.
He's getting away!
Don't give chase.
But he's going to escape again!
Don't worry, he's not going far.
{partner} is right behind him.
{partner} is following him? We wouldn't need to follow him if you'd let me-
Don't you find it odd how we captured {banditleader1} not that long ago, and he's out here raiding again already?
He must have escaped the {arbiter} who took custody of him. What was his name? {ArbiterLeader1}.<page>Right?

In the meantime, let's see if anyone here needs our help.
It looked like you were arguing with that man.

{mentor} would be proud of you, I think.
I hope so, but I still have a ways to go before I can measure up to my mother's legacy.
I know she was your mentor, but were you and mother close friends as well?
We were. She was an exceptional mentor and a true friend.
{partner} should be back soon, I think.
That took longer than I expected.
{banditleader1} is quite the slippery fellow, cautious and difficult to track. It took all of my considerable cunning not to be seen.

It is more or less as we expected, {hero}, though their operation may be even bigger than we thought.<page>They've hit other settlements beyond {mapname-town2} and {mapname-oasis01}, and I wager they're not finished yet.

I tracked {banditleader1} to a local rendezvous point. In my opinion, we should strike quickly and hard, and break up their operation for good.<page>How we handle it is up to you, of course.

Halt!
Turn around and begone. This will be your only warning.
Greetings.
